results.title: Comparative cardioprotective effects of carvedilol versus atenolol in a rat model of cardiorenal syndrome type 4.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@Carvedilol@@@ was more effective than @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in improving kidney functions, decreasing elevated blood pressures, attenuating @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@, reducing serum @GENE_NPPB @GENE_25105 @@@brain natriuretic peptide@@@, and diminished @DISEASE_Neoplasms_Fibrous_Tissue @DISEASE_MESH:D018218 @@@cardiac fibrous tissue deposition@@@.

citations.NLM: Mohamed RMSM, Elshazly SM, Nafea OE, Abd El Motteleb DM. Comparative cardioprotective effects of carvedilol versus atenolol in a rat model of cardiorenal syndrome type 4. Naunyn Schmiedebergs Arch Pharmacol. 2021 Oct;394(10):2117-2128. PMID: 34398250
citations.BibTeX: @article{34398250, title={Comparative cardioprotective effects of carvedilol versus atenolol in a rat model of cardiorenal syndrome type 4.}, author={Mohamed RMSM and Elshazly SM and Nafea OE and Abd El Motteleb DM}, journal={Naunyn Schmiedebergs Arch Pharmacol}, volume={394}, number={10}, pages={2117-2128}}

results.title: Effects of third-generation beta-blockers, atenolol or amlodipine on blood pressure variability and target organ damage in spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@Carvedilol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ were more effective than @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in the prevention of @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@, and cardiac @DISEASE_Collagen_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D003095 @@@and aortic collagen deposit@@@.

citations.NLM: Del Mauro JS, Prince PD, Allo MA, Santander Plantamura Y, Morettón MA, González GE, Bertera FM, Carranza A, Gorzalczany SB, Chiappetta DA, Morales C, Gelpi RJ, Taira CA, Polizio AH, Donato M, Höcht C. Effects of third-generation beta-blockers, atenolol or amlodipine on blood pressure variability and target organ damage in spontaneously hypertensive rats. J Hypertens. 2020 Mar;38(3):536-545. PMID: 32028517
citations.BibTeX: @article{32028517, title={Effects of third-generation beta-blockers, atenolol or amlodipine on blood pressure variability and target organ damage in spontaneously hypertensive rats.}, author={Del Mauro JS and Prince PD and Allo MA and Santander Plantamura Y and Morettón MA and González GE and Bertera FM and Carranza A and Gorzalczany SB and Chiappetta DA and Morales C and Gelpi RJ and Taira CA and Polizio AH and Donato M and Höcht C}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={38}, number={3}, pages={536-545}}

results.title: Natriuretic peptides potentiate cardiac hypertrophic response to noradrenaline in rats.
results.text_hl: Infusions of @GENE_NPPA @GENE_24602 @@@ANP@@@ and @GENE_CNP @GENE_25275 @@@CNP@@@ had no significant effects on mean BP in NA-infused @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, while two natriuretic peptides potentiated @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@cardiac hypertrophic@@@ response to NA. @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@Cardiac hypertrophy@@@ induced by co-administration of NA and @GENE_NPPA @GENE_24602 @@@ANP@@@ was attenuated by treatment with @CHEMICAL_Prazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011224 @@@prazosin@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Jiang D, Matsuzaki M, Ida T, Kitamura K, Tsuruda T, Kaikita K, Kato J. Natriuretic peptides potentiate cardiac hypertrophic response to noradrenaline in rats. Peptides. 2023 May 31;166():171035. PMID: 37263541
citations.BibTeX: @article{37263541, title={Natriuretic peptides potentiate cardiac hypertrophic response to noradrenaline in rats.}, author={Jiang D and Matsuzaki M and Ida T and Kitamura K and Tsuruda T and Kaikita K and Kato J}, journal={Peptides}, volume={166}, pages={171035}}

results.title: Contribution of local renin-angiotensin system to cardiac hypertrophy, phenotypic modulation, and remodeling in TGR (mRen2)27 transgenic rats.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, the inhibitory effects of a low dose of @CHEMICAL_candesartan_cilexetil @CHEMICAL_MESH:C077793 @@@TCV-116@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@ and altered gene expressions of TGR(mRen2)27 were greater than those of @CHEMICAL_Doxazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017292 @@@doxazosin@@@ (alpha 1-adrenergic receptor blocker) combined with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, despite their similar @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotensive@@@ effects.

citations.NLM: Ohta K, Kim S, Wanibuchi H, Ganten D, Iwao H. Contribution of local renin-angiotensin system to cardiac hypertrophy, phenotypic modulation, and remodeling in TGR (mRen2)27 transgenic rats. Circulation. 1996 Aug 15;94(4):785-91. PMID: 8772703
citations.BibTeX: @article{8772703, title={Contribution of local renin-angiotensin system to cardiac hypertrophy, phenotypic modulation, and remodeling in TGR (mRen2)27 transgenic rats.}, author={Ohta K and Kim S and Wanibuchi H and Ganten D and Iwao H}, journal={Circulation}, volume={94}, number={4}, pages={785-91}}

results.title: Effects of regression of left ventricular hypertrophy following atenolol or bunazosin therapy on ischemic cardiac function and myocardial metabolism in spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: In conclusion, antihypertensive therapy with either @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_bunazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C018176 @@@bunazosin@@@ was effective in preventing @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@ and @DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@ischemic damage@@@ caused by different mechanisms.

citations.NLM: Tanaka H, Obata H, Haneda T. Effects of regression of left ventricular hypertrophy following atenolol or bunazosin therapy on ischemic cardiac function and myocardial metabolism in spontaneously hypertensive rats. Jpn Circ J. 1991 Dec;55(12):1233-45. PMID: 1837320
citations.BibTeX: @article{1837320, title={Effects of regression of left ventricular hypertrophy following atenolol or bunazosin therapy on ischemic cardiac function and myocardial metabolism in spontaneously hypertensive rats.}, author={Tanaka H and Obata H and Haneda T}, journal={Jpn Circ J}, volume={55}, number={12}, pages={1233-45}}

results.title: Long-term effects of irbesartan and atenolol on the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system in human primary hypertension: the Swedish Irbesartan Left Ventricular Hypertrophy Investigation versus Atenolol (SILVHIA).
results.text_hl: We examined long-term influence of the @GENE_AGTR1 @GENE_185 @@@angiotensin II type 1-receptor@@@ blocker @CHEMICAL_Irbesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077405 @@@irbesartan@@@ and the @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_153 @@@beta1-adrenergic receptor@@@ blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on some neurohormonal systems implicated in the pathophysiology of @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@.

citations.NLM: Malmqvist K, Ohman KP, Lind L, Nyström F, Kahan T. Long-term effects of irbesartan and atenolol on the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system in human primary hypertension: the Swedish Irbesartan Left Ventricular Hypertrophy Investigation versus Atenolol (SILVHIA). J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2003 Dec;42(6):719-26. PMID: 14639093
citations.BibTeX: @article{14639093, title={Long-term effects of irbesartan and atenolol on the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system in human primary hypertension: the Swedish Irbesartan Left Ventricular Hypertrophy Investigation versus Atenolol (SILVHIA).}, author={Malmqvist K and Ohman KP and Lind L and Nyström F and Kahan T}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={42}, number={6}, pages={719-26}}

results.title: Effect of angiotensin II blockade on cardiac hypertrophy and remodelling: a review.
results.text_hl: The only report so far regarding the effect of @GENE_AGT @GENE_183 @@@angiotensin II@@@ blockade on @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@ in @DISEASE_Essential_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000075222 @@@essential hypertension@@@ suggests a more favourable short-term effect on @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@ for the same blood @DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@ reduction with @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in a small population of mild to moderate @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensives@@@.

citations.NLM: Dahlöf B. Effect of angiotensin II blockade on cardiac hypertrophy and remodelling: a review. J Hum Hypertens. 1995 Nov;9 Suppl 5():S37-44. PMID: 8583480
citations.BibTeX: @article{8583480, title={Effect of angiotensin II blockade on cardiac hypertrophy and remodelling: a review.}, author={Dahlöf B}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={9 Suppl 5}, pages={S37-44}}

results.title: Different effects on inhibition of cardiac hypertrophy in spontaneously hypertensive rats by monotherapy and combination therapy of adrenergic receptor antagonists and/or the angiotensin II type 1 receptor blocker under comparable blood pressure reduction.
results.text_hl: To confirm that alpha1, beta adrenoceptor antagonists and angiotensin II type 1 receptor blockers (ARBs) have different abilities to attenuate progressive @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@ despite their comparable lowering of blood @DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@, we compared the effect of these agents alone or in combination on @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@hypertensive cardiac hypertrophy@@@.

citations.NLM: Asai T, Kushiro T, Fujita H, Kanmatsuse K. Different effects on inhibition of cardiac hypertrophy in spontaneously hypertensive rats by monotherapy and combination therapy of adrenergic receptor antagonists and/or the angiotensin II type 1 receptor blocker under comparable blood pressure reduction. Hypertens Res. 2005 Jan;28(1):79-87. PMID: 15969258
citations.BibTeX: @article{15969258, title={Different effects on inhibition of cardiac hypertrophy in spontaneously hypertensive rats by monotherapy and combination therapy of adrenergic receptor antagonists and/or the angiotensin II type 1 receptor blocker under comparable blood pressure reduction.}, author={Asai T and Kushiro T and Fujita H and Kanmatsuse K}, journal={Hypertens Res}, volume={28}, number={1}, pages={79-87}}

results.title: Amelioration of cardiac remodeling in congestive heart failure by beta-adrenoceptor blockade is associated with depression in sympathetic activity.
results.text_hl: Sham-operated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ served as controls. Both @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ at 20 and 75 mg/kg doses attenuated the MI-induced @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@, increases in left ventricular (LV) end-diastolic pressure, LV end-systolic volume and LV end-diastolic volume as well as @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depressions@@@ in LV systolic pressure, LV fractional shortening and cardiac output.

citations.NLM: Machackova J, Sanganalmath SK, Barta J, Dhalla KS, Dhalla NS. Amelioration of cardiac remodeling in congestive heart failure by beta-adrenoceptor blockade is associated with depression in sympathetic activity. Cardiovasc Toxicol. 2010 Mar;10(1):9-16. PMID: 19949891
citations.BibTeX: @article{19949891, title={Amelioration of cardiac remodeling in congestive heart failure by beta-adrenoceptor blockade is associated with depression in sympathetic activity.}, author={Machackova J and Sanganalmath SK and Barta J and Dhalla KS and Dhalla NS}, journal={Cardiovasc Toxicol}, volume={10}, number={1}, pages={9-16}}

results.title: Extract of Lycopus europaeus L. reduces cardiac signs of hyperthyroidism in rats.
results.text_hl: No significant changes of thyroid hormone concentrations or TSH levels were observed. Lycopus extract and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ reduced the increased heart rate and blood pressure.

citations.NLM: Vonhoff C, Baumgartner A, Hegger M, Korte B, Biller A, Winterhoff H. Extract of Lycopus europaeus L. reduces cardiac signs of hyperthyroidism in rats. Life Sci. 2006 Feb 2;78(10):1063-70. PMID: 16150466
citations.BibTeX: @article{16150466, title={Extract of Lycopus europaeus L. reduces cardiac signs of hyperthyroidism in rats.}, author={Vonhoff C and Baumgartner A and Hegger M and Korte B and Biller A and Winterhoff H}, journal={Life Sci}, volume={78}, number={10}, pages={1063-70}}
